div.a: The Biggest Financial Fraud Of All Time

div.div: “We will never know the amounts of money involved, but it has to be the biggest financial fraud of all time. Libor is the basis for calculating practically every derivative known to man.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14qQA1L&via=Digg&text=The Biggest Financial Fraud Of All Time

div.div: THINGS YOU DIDN'T KNOW YOU DIDN'T KNOW

div.a: Why Do Air Traffic Control Towers Have Slanted Windows?

div.div: Large airports are slightly different all over the world, but one constant is the ubiquitous air traffic control tower, which always has windows that slope toward the tower at the base.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/LXLrHy&via=Digg&text=Why Do Air Traffic Control Towers Have Slanted Windows?

div.div: As lightning strikes go, this is a pretty intense one.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YBz8Ii&via=Digg&text=Near Death Lightning Strike

div.div: WHO DOESN'T UNDERSTAND THE DOMINO EFFECT

div.a: Elon Musk Gives Boeing An Engineering Smackdown Over Unsafe Batteries

div.div: The lithium ion batteries installed on the Boeing 787 are inherently unsafe, says Elon Musk, founder of SpaceX and owner of electric car maker Tesla.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UB2Hq0&via=Digg&text=Elon Musk Gives Boeing An Engineering Smackdown Over Unsafe Batteries

div.a: The Original Endings Of 10 Famous Films

div.div: We took a look at other popular movies and their original endings (as always, there may be spoilers). Did the final cuts triumph?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UyqYgo&via=Digg&text=The Original Endings Of 10 Famous Films

div.a: How The EVE Online Servers Deal With A 3,000 Person Battle

div.div: One of the largest battles in EVE Online history took place due to an accidental click. It’s what happens next that is interesting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X6aZD9&via=Digg&text=How The EVE Online Servers Deal With A 3,000 Person Battle

div.a: U.N. Drone Investigator Might Be A Deadly Robot's Worst Nightmare

div.div: Ben Emmerson wants to be clear: He’s not out to ban flying killer robots used by the CIA or the U.S. military. But the 49-year-old British lawyer is about to become the bane of the drones’ existence, thanks to the U.N. inquiry he launched last week into their deadly operations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YeSHlY&via=Digg&text=U.N. Drone Investigator Might Be A Deadly Robot's Worst Nightmare

div.div: It turns out we’ve been eating the spiced dish for a lot longer than anyone ever imagined.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wd3xdw&via=Digg&text=Where Did Curry Come From?

div.div: THAT'LL TEACH YOU TO TEXT AND DRIVE

div.a: Iran's Terrifying Intimidation Device Will Cut Your Fingers Off

div.div: It's a grisly tool that the regime is using to send a message.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WdQUz5&via=Digg&text=Iran's Terrifying Intimidation Device Will Cut Your Fingers Off

div.a: Armed 'Good Guys' And The Realities Of Facing A Gunman

div.div: Police now believe an early challenge, even an unsuccessful one, by a cop or a civilian — can rattle a mass shooter. It can push him to a different course of action.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WuWBrV&via=Digg&text=Armed 'Good Guys' And The Realities Of Facing A Gunman

div.a: Ashton Kutcher's Steve Jobs Movie Makeup Is Totally Unreal—He IS Jobs

div.div: Whoa. We've seen Ashton Kutcher in a scene from early in the upcoming Steve Jobs biopic, and had an early review of the film as well, but this is the first we've seen of his makeup for the latter day Jobs. And man, it's something.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XImaSt&via=Digg&text=Ashton Kutcher's Steve Jobs Movie Makeup Is Totally Unreal—He IS Jobs

div.a: As Music Streaming Grows, Royalties Slow To A Trickle

div.div: But as the companies behind digital services like Spotify swell into multibillion-dollar enterprises, the relative trickle of money that has made its way to artists is causing anxiety at every level of the business.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wd5PcE&via=Digg&text=As Music Streaming Grows, Royalties Slow To A Trickle

div.a: Can Cory Booker Keep It Together?

div.div: The mayor of Newark is in control of his own narrative like no other man or woman in politics. But will he be able to run the same show from the national stage?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XbtPu7&via=Digg&text=Can Cory Booker Keep It Together?

div.a: The Controversy Over Two Guys Marrying A Tree

div.div: An art stunt with muddy ideas sparks an epic fight, leading to claims of homophobia, vandalism -- even prostitution.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XcZaN0&via=Digg&text=The Controversy Over Two Guys Marrying A Tree

div.a: How Facebook Survived 34 Intense Days Of 'Lockdown' To Build Graph Search

div.div: Product manager Loren Cheng of Facebook's Graph Search team opens up about the sleep-deprived run-up to launch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XcJDwS&via=Digg&text=How Facebook Survived 34 Intense Days Of 'Lockdown' To Build Graph Search

div.a: So Apparently, We’ve Been Using Chinese Takeout Boxes All Wrong

div.div: In the case of the 1st world’s most epically disproportionate problems, we have just learned that our use of Chinese food takeout boxes is horribly inefficient.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/118tf60&via=Digg&text=So Apparently, We’ve Been Using Chinese Takeout Boxes All Wrong

div.a: A Brief History Of Racist Soft Drinks

div.div: Lots of people know about how Coca-Cola used to contain cocaine or how Pepsi was the hip drink in the 1960s. Few realize that Coke marketed assiduously to whites, while Pepsi hired a "negro markets" department.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WKSLJb&via=Digg&text=A Brief History Of Racist Soft Drinks

div.div: This was the Super Bowl commercial that was rejected by CBS.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WzsOLE&via=Digg&text=Pornhub's Rejected Super Bowl Commercial

div.a: Google Earth 1945 Overlay Might Prove Crop Circle Phenomenon Is No Hoax

div.div: A historian believes he has buried forever the "serial" lie that crop circles are the work of hoaxers – by unearthing images of them dating back to 1945 and beyond. It’s "barley" believable, but Greg Jefferys has also uncovered evidence of the phenomenon in scientific documents dating back to 1880.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10T9OJQ&via=Digg&text=Google Earth 1945 Overlay Might Prove Crop Circle Phenomenon Is No Hoax

div.a: High School Math Teacher In Trouble For Tweeting Nude Photos, Calling Students 'Jailbait'

div.div: Semi-nude selfies and jokes about on-campus drug use are just some of the things found on one Colorado math teacher's Twitter page.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14sG8YH&via=Digg&text=High School Math Teacher In Trouble For Tweeting Nude Photos, Calling Students 'Jailbait'

div.a: With More Food Than Ever, Why Is Hunger On The Rise?

div.div: Virtualization is a powerful tool for improving the real world. When we translate material things, from genes to jet planes, into numbers, we can analyze and manipulate them far more easily. But virtualization can also have disastrous real-word consequences, especially when it comes to food.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wz7aHm&via=Digg&text=With More Food Than Ever, Why Is Hunger On The Rise?

div.a: Who Was The First Human Ancestor?

div.div: From the time of Charles Darwin, science has painted a picture of our earliest ancestor in the image of a chimpanzee. Now, new fossil evidence is redrawing the lines of human evolution.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XPpEU3&via=Digg&text=Who Was The First Human Ancestor?

div.div: THE SWAN SONG OF BROKEN TOOTH

div.a: How The Gambling Capital Of The World Got Rid Of Its Gangsters

div.div: When Wan Kuok-koi, 57, better known as Broken Tooth, was released from prison last month, nearly 14 years after he went behind bars, he emerged to a city utterly transformed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VLlUnO&via=Digg&text=How The Gambling Capital Of The World Got Rid Of Its Gangsters

div.a: 26 Apple Designs That Never Came To Be

div.div: In Design Forward, Frog Design's founder, Hartmut Esslinger, recounts the inspirations and process behind the computers that revolutionized consumer electronics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VmfvQb&via=Digg&text=26 Apple Designs That Never Came To Be

div.a: The Psychology Of The To-Do List

div.div: Your mind loves it when a plan comes together – the mere act of planning how to do something frees us from the burden of unfinished tasks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XcxiZp&via=Digg&text=The Psychology Of The To-Do List

div.div: CARPE DIEM WAS TOTALLY THEIR YOLO

div.a: What Does First-Century Roman Graffiti Say?

div.div: Work at Rome’s Colosseum turns up 2,000-year-old scrawling.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VnY69E&via=Digg&text=What Does First-Century Roman Graffiti Say?

div.a: Ultimate Yosemite Video Took 30 Photographers To Make

div.div: We have seen some great videos of Yosemite in our time. But let us tell you — this is the Yosemite video to beat all Yosemite videos. Yes, there are the usual stars and shooting stars and sunrises and sunsets and light glistening off of water. But there are also horses. And hikers. And hang gliders.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UAmdmm&via=Digg&text=Ultimate Yosemite Video Took 30 Photographers To Make

div.a: That Daily Shower Can Be A Killer

div.div: The other morning, I escaped unscathed from a dangerous situation. No, an armed robber didn’t break into my house, nor did I find myself face to face with a mountain lion during my bird walk. What I survived was my daily shower.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14oJwDU&via=Digg&text=That Daily Shower Can Be A Killer

div.a: These Guys Have Been Playing A Game Of Tag For 23 Years

div.div: Earlier this month, Brian Dennehy started a new job as chief marketing officer of Nordstrom. In his first week, he pulled aside a colleague to ask a question: How hard it is for a nonemployee to enter the building?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XcWZZO&via=Digg&text=These Guys Have Been Playing A Game Of Tag For 23 Years

div.a: Why Are Japanese Cartoons A Global Hit?

div.div: Japanese anime — animation, usually in the form of hand-drawn cartoons — is a wildly popular global export: According to one estimate, about 60 percent of the world’s animated television shows originate in Japan.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YzHSPo&via=Digg&text=Why Are Japanese Cartoons A Global Hit?

div.div: For 40 years, this Russian family was cut off from all human contact, even unaware of World War II.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XaASTZ&via=Digg&text=The Family Time Forgot
